title: Spack hangs during installation when target architecture is provided by spack.yaml file

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

I'm on the Theta supercomputer. I have a spack.yaml file describing an environment I want to install. When I create the environment, activate it, then type `spack install`, spack hangs indefinitely on this message:

```
==> No binary for argobots-1.0-fmw2ekbof2tuxbqb6b2a3tdynnrp3pvi found: installing from source
```

(The argobots package here is for the example; it blocks just as well when the environment contains anoother packages)

After experimenting with many variants of my spack.yaml file, I found that spack will hang if and only if the `target` field is provided. For example the following minimal spack.yaml will make spack hang:

```
spack:
  specs:
  - argobots%gcc@9.3.0
  packages:
    all:
      target:
      - mic_knl
  view: true
```
... but removing the two lines about the `target` makes it work fine.

For the sake of full reproducibility, here is a more complete spack.yaml file that also includes the compiler, so no yaml file is required in ~/.spack:

```
spack:
  specs:
  - argobots%gcc@9.3.0
  compilers:
  - compiler:
      paths:
        cc: cc
        cxx: CC
        f77: ftn
        fc: ftn
      operating_system: cnl7
      target: any
      modules:
      - PrgEnv-gnu
      - gcc/9.3.0
      environment: {}
      extra_rpaths: []
      flags: {}
      spec: gcc@9.3.0
  packages:
    all:
      providers:
        mpi: [ mpich ]
      compiler:
      - gcc@9.3.0
      target:
      - mic_knl
      version: []
      buildable: true
```
### Steps to reproduce the issue

Copy the above spack.yaml on Theta.

```console
$ spack env create myenv spack.yaml
$ spack env activate myenv
$ spack install
...
```

### Error Message

<!-- If Spack reported an error, provide the error message. If it did not report an error but the output appears incorrect, provide the incorrect output. If there was no error message and no output but the result is incorrect, describe how it does not match what you expect. -->
```console
$ spack --debug --stacktrace install
```
The above shows the following debug message from spack many times before blocking:

```
gpfs/mira-home/mdorier/spack/lib/spack/spack/compilers/__init__.py:446 ==> [2021-01-13-11:46:50.769068] Multiple definitions of compiler gcc@9.3.0for architecture cray-cnl7-mic_knl:
 [gcc(cc
     CC
     ftn
     ftn
     ['PrgEnv-gnu', 'gcc/9.3.0']
     cnl7), gcc(cc
     CC
     ftn
     ftn
     ['PrgEnv-gnu', 'gcc/9.3.0']
     cnl7)]
```

I initially thought that spack was finding both the compiler definition in my ~/.spack/compilers.yaml file and in the spack.yaml file, but (1) the problem still persists if I remove gcc@9.3.0 from my compilers.yaml file, and (2) the problem still persists if I remove the compiler definition from the spack.yaml file.

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->

* **Spack:** 0.16.0 (tested with develop as well)
* **Python:** 3.6.10
* **Platform:** cray-sles15-haswell

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->
